First of all, when you have a bottleneck, you should profile (several 
times) to ensure that you know what is the real bottleneck.

Is JFCUnit actually moving the pointer or simply stuffing things into 
the event queue?

When moving the pointer, you are more limited by the native window 
response time than the actual pointer motion (things like popup menus 
and windows displaying take a certain amount of time, and don't 
recognize events until they are fully "ready", from a native code 
perspective).  If you're stuffing the event queue, there's not much you 
can do unless JFCUnit has some built-in delays or is slow in and of 
itself (doubtful).

The bottom line is that eventually, you will have more tests than you 
have time, so you'll need to reorganize them in a sensible way so they 
are grouped around related code/functionality.

On Monday, September 22, 2003, at 01:52 AM, cpac_22 wrote:

> I'm currently using jfcunit (and learning as I go), I've got a set of
> test cases that working 100% but it takes 6 minutes to run them,
> because the mouse is moving slow. It isn't ultra slow or anything
> but, I think it could be faster.
>
> So my question is, does anyone know how to make the mouse move
> somewhere faster?
>
subject: Re: [junit] Increase mouse speed
